results.title: Exploitation of errors
results.creator_credit: Harry D Ruderman, Davidson Films and General Learning Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows how guesses for solutions to an equation can be pictured in graph form. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Introducing globes. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: John Lord and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Animation and live-action are combined to explain many ways a globe can be used to help develop an understanding of the earth. Introduces concepts of latitude, longitude and rotation and notes the advantages of globes over flat maps. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Khmer! Khmer!: Cambodia in conflict (D)
results.creator_credit: James G. Gerrand, ABC and Experimental Film and Television Fund
results.brief_description: Portrays the life, culture, history and politics of the Cambodians. Focuses on Norodom Sihanouk’s abdication from the throne and becoming the first Democratic Leader of Cambodia, thus destroying the old feudal system and through to social and political destruction during the Vietnam War. Narrated by Richard Oxenburgh. WARNING: Contains graphic scenes of war related deaths.

results.title: Supply and demand
results.creator_credit: Ted Abenheim, Bruce Stubblefield and Greenhouse Films
results.brief_description: Basic introductory film on the concepts of supply and demand. Defines the law of supply and the law of demand, shows how the equilibrium point between these two laws determines prices, and provides examples of these laws in real life.

results.title: Role call
results.brief_description: Looks at sexism and sex-role stereotyping and explores many of the commonly held myths. Shows two secondary schools where students participate in a “progressive coeducational” program and notes both teacher and student attitudes to their roles. We see this through woodwork, sewing, cooking and sports. However, issues such as non-gender specific language and parental attitudes are also raised and explored. Suitable for upper secondary level.

Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Paradise lost: The Firebird by Stravinsky from Allegro non Troppo
results.brief_description: Excerpt from Bruno Bozzetto’s “Allegro Non Troppo”. Adam and Eve refuse to be tempted and the snake which eats the forbidden fruit tumbles through a myriad futuristic psychedelia. Music from Stravinsky’s “Firebird”. Animation by Walter Cavazzuti. No commentary, music only. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: A Merry Chase: Prelude a L'apres midi d'un faune by Claude Debussy
results.brief_description: Excerpt from Bruno Bozzetto’s “Allegro Non Troppo”. A squat and aging satyr lusts for the sexual attention of young nymphs of the serene woodland. Music from Debussy.

results.title: Let it bee: Concerto in C Minor by Vivaldi
results.brief_description: Excerpt from Bruno Bozzetto’s “Allegro Non Troppo”. A domesticated honey-bee prepares a picnic with wine and cheese but is disturbed by a romancing couple bent also on picnicking. Music from Vivaldi. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Last meow: 'Valse Triste', Jean Sibelius
results.brief_description: Excerpt from “Allegro Non Troppo” by Bruno Bozzetto with music by Jean Sibelius. A scrawny cat prowls the crumbling ruins of a house, remembering the warmth and snugness of family life he once enjoyed. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: From one to many: Dvorak's 'Slavic Dance No. 7'
results.brief_description: Excerpt from Bruno Bozzetto’s “Allegro Non Troppo”. An animated comment on social confirmity set to the music of Dvorak. Featuring the Berlin Philharmonic Orchestra conducted by Herbert Von Karajan. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
